DOC.brief_title: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure Via Binasal Prong v Nasal Mask : Randomised Controlled Trial
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVE : To determine affect rate ( bronchopulmonary dysplasia ) BPD death NCPAP therapy nasal prong nasal mask initial treatment respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) . METHODS : Inborn preterm infant gestational age 26-32 week , respiratory distress syndrome enrol single-centered , unblinded randomize prospective control trial . They stabilize T-piece device delivery room . Immediately admission neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) , infant randomly assign receive NCPAP either nasal prong mask . NCPAP continue set PEEP 5 8 cm H2O . RESULTS : 160 infant assessed eligibility 149 infant randomize . Finally 75 infant Group I ( nasal prong ) 74 Group II ( nasal mask ) analyze . Mean gestational age 29.3±1.6 vs 29.1±2.0 week ( p=0.55 ) birth weight 1225±257 vs. 1282±312 gram ( p=0.22 ) respectively Group I Group II . The frequency NCPAP failure within 24 hour life high Group I compare Group 2 ( respectively 8 % , % 0 , p=0.09 ) difference significant . The outcome BPD death rate differ among group ( Group I 9.3 % vs. Group II 9.4 % ; p=0.96 ) . CONCLUSIONS : Applied nasal mask feasible method deliver NCPAP effective nasal prong initial treatment RDS preterm infant .
